entry.title: [rebaseline-cl] Simplify fill-missing UX
entry.content:
Based on discussion in crbug.com/1475247, `rebaseline-cl --fill-missing`

still seems useful for downloading platform-agnostic expectations

without the round-trip of retrying infrastructure failures, but it's not

a feature users actively seek out. Therefore:

* Hide the `--{no-,}fill-missing` options with a deprecation message

(i.e., the feature is only available for infrastructure failures).

There's no automation that uses these options.

* Remove a redundant user prompt. It's no longer possible to continue

with incomplete results.



Bug: 1383284

Change-Id: Icdedba8e406252041da4fa7ccaf4c6f60ef1ce8f

entry.title: [SDA] Avoid initializing a deferred start time based on a potentially stale timeline.
entry.content:
Previously, the start time of an animation could be initialized during

the update snapshot phase as well as the snapshot validation phase.

The snapshot is stale during the update snapshot phase if a layout

dependency is introduced during style-update.



The stale start time will get corrected during snapshot validation;

however, we can trigger unexpected animationstart or animationend

events based on the stale start time. We prevent this, but only

initializing the start time during snapshot validation.



Bug: 1470309

Change-Id: Ibbe09247545ce06a8c723f96d015b0263aba9c7f

entry.title: Annotate new lacros dangling pointers..
entry.content:
The ExperimentalAsh raw_ptr annotation disable BackupRefPtr (UAF

protection) and the DanglingPointerDetector. It was used to make a

performance experiment. It must be ignored by developers and no new

occurrences must be added.



We are going to remove ExperimentalAsh experiment and annotation.



Since it allowed developers to opt-out from the dangling pointer

detector, we must annotate temporarily "pre-existing" dangling pointers

to land the change:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4768316/29



This patch is annotating two new dangling pointers added yesterday:

1. https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4781190

2. https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4472396



and two more in zaura_shell.



Bug: chromium:1435441,chromium:1430482

Change-Id: Iefb405da55eed5dc000ce56703ed3011f630de9c

entry.title: webauthn: don't configure extra discoveries without UI.
entry.content:
`ChromeAuthenticatorRequestDelegate` configures a number of extra

discoveries by default, but they don't generally make a lot of sense

without Chrome's WebAuthn UI.



Credit-card autofill disables the WebAuthn UI because it has its own

modal dialog, but these discoveries were still being configured. This

was mostly moot (although it's been possible to register an autofill

credential on an Android device via a USB cable all this time). It's

recently become problematic on macOS because it means that both the

profile authenticator and iCloud Keychain would trigger concurrently.



This change skips configuring these extra discoveries when the UI is

disabled.



Fixed: 1476933

Change-Id: Iae92d56b8107b1b6d48c667d5b969eb1422706a3

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4823777

Auto-Submit: Adam Langley

Reviewed-by: Nina Satragno

Commit-Queue: Nina Satragno

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1190205}

entry.title: mac fullscreen: reparent web dialogs on entering and exiting fullscreen
entry.content:
Web dialogs will be occluded by the toolbar if they are created before

entering fullscreen. This is because the dialogs are children of the

browser window, which is behind the overlay widget.



This CL fixes the issue by:

* Add a kWidgetIdentifierKey native widget property to widgets.

* Mark constrained windows (e.g. web dialogs) using

kWidgetIdentifierKey.

* Reparent constrained windows to overlay window when entering

fullscreen.



kWidgetIdentifierKey would allow identifying a widget more easily. It

decouples the code that creates a widget from the code that wants to

identify a widget.



Bug: 1469898, 1476502

Change-Id: I379fa9da7d11c21dd8d1e00e9e808e9673ab9540

entry.title: bento_button: Button not show up on 2nd display for RTL
entry.content:
This CL will fix the bug that when the UI direction is RTL, on the 2nd

display, no bento button shows up. The reason is that its position is

calculated based on the `shelf_navigation_widget`. While when

calculating the `shelf_navigation_widget`'s x value, we forgot that it

should be offset with the shelf origin.

entry.title: [SavedTabGroups] Fix Tab Discarding causing crashes.
entry.content:
When tabs are discarded, they replace the webcontents ptr with a

different web_contents ptr. In SavedTabGroups, the listeners did not

react to this change, and didnt update the stored ptr.



In this CL, TabStripModelChanged observer method is updated to listen

to the kReplaced change and rebuilds the webcontentslistener with the

correct webcontents ptr.

entry.title: TTS: Modify TTS service to work with XNNPack (part 2)
entry.content:
This change is the second half of fixing the TTS - XNNPack bug.

This change does several things:



1. Calls GoogleTtsPreSandboxInit (added in an internal change),

which explicitly initializes cpuinfo. This is done because cpuinfo

is needed by some XNNPack code within libchrometts.so.

2. Gives the TTS service permission to call getcpu, which is used on

arm64. Without this change, TTS doesn't work on arm64.

3. Removes the read permission to /proc/cpuinfo, which was initially

added to address b:269146620 on x86_64. This was a temporary fix

and is now unnecessary given the above two changes. See this design

doc [1] for more details.



[1] https://docs.google.com/document/d/1pU8hRzE0Z_eph-MeVYv_EWlbtrRhxXmHEwHbtPVoXhM/edit?usp=sharing



(from fig client) # Run script to deploy Google TTS

(from chrome-sdk) autoninja -C out_${SDK_BOARD}/Release chrome nacl_helper

(from chrome-sdk) deploy_chrome --device=localhost:2224 --build-dir=out_${SDK_BOARD}/Release

(on device) Turn on ChromeVox and ensure speech output.



Bug: b:269146620,b:296458143

Test: Manually on x86_64 and arm64.

Change-Id: Ifc500da14a0f9207cac8e0fb177a8bbddc259489

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4503801

entry.title: [iOS] Fix Windows epoch bug in new Safety Check module.
entry.content:
If the Safety Check has never been run before, the new Safety Check

module will use the default, unset Last Run Time, which is the Windows

epoch (January 1, 1601). For new Safety Check users, the Last Run Time

of the Safety Check will, incorrectly & confusingly, display "422 years

ago".



This change introduces a bug fix via:



1. Updating the SafetyCheckState `lastRunTime` to

absl::optional.



2. Displaying the Last Run Time only if the run happened within the last

24 hours.



Change-Id: I46a30df4b21ad60d526d36e7b9bbde7767d5fbc5

Fixed: 1476513

Low-Coverage-Reason: Tests coming soon.

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4818526

Commit-Queue: Benjamin Williams

Reviewed-by: Chris Lu

entry.title: Reland "Toss stale a11y serializations that were sent by a renderer while the browser was changing AXMode"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit e63b2d3673aeab6fdf61af7a8d16f208d19862b9



** Reason for revert: new CHECK() caused AccessibilityIpcErrorBrowserTest.ResetBrowserAccessibilityManager to fail on many bots, because the test used set_no_create_browser_accessibility_manager_for_testing(true).

The test is only enabled on builds without DCHECKs enabled, thus failed in CQ.

Sample failure on linux-bfcache-rel:

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/linux-bfcache-rel/50476/test-results?sortby=&groupby=

The same new CHECK() was also sometimes triggered when SendAccessibilityEventsToManager() was called by UpdateAXTreeData().

This was filed as in crbug.com/1477218.

** How addressed:

Removed new CHECK added in RenderFrameHostImpl::SendAccessibilityEventsToManager() which tries to ensure that kNavtiveAPIs was clear when there was no BrowserAccessibilityManager.



Original change's description:

> Toss stale a11y serializations that were sent by a renderer while the

> browser was changing AXMode

>

> When the accessibility mode changes, the page is reset and then the

> entire page is re-sent from the root down (because the entire page is

> marked dirty).

>

> Any in flight serializations from right before the mode change was

> received are obsolete and should be thrown on the floor.

>

> Without this change, the obsolete serialization could be applied to a

> brand new AXTree that was recently created because of the mode change,

> and which doesn't have the nodes being referred to in the serialization,

> causing mysterious fatal errors in AXTree in the form, "Node X will not

> be in the tree and is not the new root".

>

> Bug: 1471373

> Change-Id: Ib15fec5355aee5fd515675a56034d5fb8e786c12

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4814368

> Auto-Submit: Aaron Leventhal

> Reviewed-by: David Tseng

> Reviewed-by: John Abd-El-Malek

> Reviewed-by: Robert Sesek

entry.title: graphite: Add support for Dawn Vulkan/Swiftshader on Linux
entry.content:
Allow specifying dawn-d3d11, dawn-swiftshader, dawn-vulkan, etc. with

--skia-graphite-backend.



Fix issues with dawn-swiftshader and dawn-vulkan on Linux:



1) Use BGRA SkColorType for BGRA/X formats in SkiaOutputDeviceOffscreen.

2) Implement Graphite readback path in SkiaOutputDeviceX11.

3) Fix Graphite enabled state in about:gpu with --skia-graphite-backend.

4) Register gpu.graphite.dawn trace category emitted by Dawn Vulkan.



There are still known issues with Dawn Vulkan/Swiftshader:



1) Multiplanar support is not universal on Vulkan drivers.

2) Dawn Vulkan external image is not thread-safe.

3) Graphite Dawn Swiftshader cannot allocate GL compatible shared image.



So this should only be limited to testing.



Bug: 1464832

Change-Id: I12c916c264de969a7aed126478ca914c90d356fa

entry.title: Make SigninPromoViewMediatorTest compatible with newer OCMock versions.
entry.content:
Specifically the RemoveSigninPromoAndDeallocMediatorWhileSignedIn test

wants to verify what happens after `mediator_` is deallocated. However

changes in OCMock lifetime handling (specifically in how it now

retains all object arguments passed to mocked methods, not just their

expectations) would cause `consumer_` to keep `mediator_` alive.



This fixes this issue by adding a new `clearInvocations` method to

(our extension to) OCMockObject, which clears the internal

`invocations` array.

Additionally most of the test is wrapped in an @autoreleasepool to

make sure that any "autoreleased" objects that can contain references

to `mediator_` also get released.



Bug: 1476506

Change-Id: I69ac6053eeebc560ab38b97d589e3f1112eac1b8

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4819570

Reviewed-by: Robert Sesek

Reviewed-by: Jérôme Lebel

Commit-Queue: Marijn Kruisselbrink

entry.title: [Autofill] Remove FieldTypeGroup::kFooBilling, rename kFooAddress
entry.content:
This CL removes the billing-specific FieldTypeGroups since they

lead to an inconsistency: for example, for

t = AutofillType(HtmlFieldType::kName, HTmlFieldType::kBilling)

we have

t.group() != GroupTypeOfServerFieldType(t.GetStorableType())



With this CL, this inconsistency still exists, but only if

t.GetStorableType() == UNKNOWN_TYPE.



crrev.com/c/3689421 had intentionally left the FieldTypeGroups in

the code to ease later support of billing-specific field types.



Before this CL, all occurrences of a billing FieldTypeGroup were

treated equivalently to the corresponding non-billing FieldTypeGroup,

e.g.,

(foo == kAddressHome || foo == kAddressBilling).

On the flipside, not every non-billing FieldTypeGroup occurs

together with the corresponding billing FieldTypeGroup. Some of

these were arguably bugs, e.g., FastCheckoutClient.



Bug: 1476882

Change-Id: I93e51ced5f5ef0d6d1f2ba85f1001da1de154d32

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4823026

Reviewed-by: Matthias Körber

entry.title: Permuting types is not invalid for relative color syntax
entry.content:
See: https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/9094

"""

All values are numbers (or hue angles as numbers) and there is no scaling or mapping of ranges.

"""



From: https://drafts.csswg.org/css-color-5/#ex-no-percentage-magic

"""

Beware when using components outside their normal position; when

percentages are resolved, there is no "magic scaling" to account for the

changed position.

"""



Since all values are numbers, any parameter can be matched with any

other.



These changes make color-invalid-relative-color-expected.txt in

virtual/stable redundant, as it was all PASS.



Bug: 1447327

Change-Id: I674da3f953e0ce336757b593beb6c205528e7800

entry.title: Reland "[exo] Integrate ClientTracker and IsClientDestroyed()"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 2e173b708943051cb1c236e8d5ffbdef638d7462



See diff against patchset 1 for changes.



The reland fixes the ServerTest.Dispatch test. The issue was

wl_listeners were added to the wl_display and wl_client and these

listeners were destroyed before they were removed from either

object's signal lists.



This resulted in UAFs when the ClientTracker was added (which was

correctly removing its listeners, however this involved updating

its neighboring listener list elements which had been freed but

not removed).



Original change's description:

> [exo] Integrate ClientTracker and IsClientDestroyed()

>

> This CL adds the ClientTracker to the exo::wayland::Server instance

> to ensure that the construction / destruction of clients can be

> accurately observed for a given wl_display (which is 1:1 with a

> Server instance).

>

> A utility method is exposed to allow code to query whether a

> wl_client has started destruction. This allows code to check whether

> it is safe to iterate over / query the clients resources.

>

> This replaces more bespoke methods used to achieve similar ends

> for the WaylandDisplayObserver.

>

> Bug: 1459067

> Change-Id: Iec9bc424b7fdca756d935998f75947b67d628911

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4786809

> Reviewed-by: Mitsuru Oshima

> Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

> Commit-Queue: Thomas Lukaszewicz

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1188432}



Bug: 1459067

Change-Id: Iff0de9d9a3fc3008316b3c4948cdf1d0a82beada

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4819353

Reviewed-by: Mitsuru Oshima

Commit-Queue: Thomas Lukaszewicz

Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

entry.title: [Payments] Model and View for virtual card enrollment bottom sheet
entry.content:
This patch adds a skeleton Model-View-Controller (MVC) for the virtual

card number (VCN) enrollment bottom sheet. This initial UI displays only

a prompt (e.g., "Enroll a virtual card?") and two buttons: one to accept

and one to cancel. The UI is hidden behind a flag:

chrome://flags/#autofill-enable-payments-android-bottom-sheet.

entry.title: Removed wrong call to delete account profiles
entry.content:
The ClearAllLocalData() function in the PDM is used to reset

all previously imported profiles. However, account profiles are

not considered local in the database. As a result, they are

loaded again after clearing which breaks the test.

entry.title: Introduce CustomTabs.Startup.TimeToFirstCommitNavigation
entry.content:
Adds a new metric for Custom Tabs startup until the first navigation

commit, split by various levels of warmed-up-ness.



For cold starts, using the process creation time rather than the

intent received time will better represent the difference between warm

and cold starts. For warm cases the intent received/oncreate time are

the earliest measurable points for when startup began.

entry.title: Fix stack overflow in canvas context-lost web tests
entry.content:
For the tests `offscreencanvas-lost-gpu-context.html` and

`offscreencanvas-oncontextlost.html`, the function `contextLost` was

conflicting with another function of the same name, defined in

`canvas-context-lost-events.js`. The net effect was that for these

tests, `contextLost` was actually calling itself.



This made the test flaky because in practice, the test doesn't wait for

the context to be lost, so the callback is rarely invoked. This will be

fixed in a follow-up CL.



Bug: 1476080

entry.title: [Payments] Coordinator and Mediator for virtual card enrollment
entry.content:
This patch adds the Coordinator and Mediator classes from the Android's

Model-View-Controller (MVC) pattern to the Virtual Card Number (VCN)

enrollment bottom sheet UI.



The Mediator shows a blank bottom sheet that can be dismissed

either by the user or when the C++ bridge is destroyed.



This version of VCN enrollment is behind a flag:

chrome://flags/#autofill-enable-payments-android-bottom-sheet.

entry.title: Use the custom epsilons for color tests and make failure messages better
entry.content:
The tests from the spec include multistep calculations, so I added a

wider epsilon of 0.02 for these.



We now pass 100% of color-valid-relative-color!



Also, failure messages with the new fuzzy color tests could be somewhat

inscrutable. Add some more information and format these better here.

This is why the rebaseline in virtual/stable is necessary.

entry.title: [oobe] Make sure MultiStepBehavior comes after LoginScreenBehavior
entry.content:
Both MultiStepBehavior and LoginScreenBehavior specify defaultControl

getter, which is used by the display_manager.js to call onBeforeShow,

onBeforeHide and focus. The override from the last behavior in the

list is used and MultiStepBehavior specifies more accurate

defaultControl element of the screen.

entry.title: [ios] Fix the egtest failure on phone form factor.
entry.content:
The `isTabScrolledToTop` calculation is broken recently. Its purpose

originally is not clear and the maintenance cost is high. Hence remove

it for the use cases new tab and tab grid button. Add TODO to remove

other use cases.



For the use cases here, the only relevance might be when the tab is NOT

scrolled to the top, the button that the IPH is anchored to might be

hidden. To avoid this scenario, check the visibility of the anchored

view, and verify by the Egtests.



Fixed: 1470901

entry.title: Continue registering GridCell for drop operations
entry.content:
When migrating to diffable data source, I stopped registering cell

classes with string-based reuse identifiers, as the data source doesn't

need it anymore.

But it happens that drop operation (by way of

UICollectionViewDropPlaceholder) still needs to register the cells that

can be used when creating a new item as the result of a drop:

https://developer.apple.com/documentation/uikit/uicollectionviewdropplaceholder?language=objc



This CL adds back the registration for GridCell.

entry.title: [CodeHealth] Avoid dangling PrefService pointer in PasswordStore.
entry.content:
PasswordStore is a refcounted profile-keyed service, it's expected,

but not guaranteed, to be destructed before the profile is destructed.

However it's notified about shutdown, and should not hold the pointer

to profile's prefs after that.

entry.title: Add hash-prefix real-time lookups relay URL check to HideRequest method
entry.content:
This hides Safe Browsing network requests through the relay from

extensions.



Other changes in this CL:

- WebRequestPermissions::HideRequest is modified instead of the child

method IsSafeBrowsingUrl because of the URL check's dependency on

/browser.

- ExtensionWebRequestPermissionsTest has test cases added both for the

feature-on and feature-off cases.



Note that none of the code in this CL is expected to be temporary; the

feature-off case will be long-lived since the feature flag will not be

deprecated.

entry.title: [Autofill] Remove ContentAutofillRouter::last_queried_{source,target}_
entry.content:
ContentAutofillRouter::last_queried_{source,target}_ track the driver

for which AskForValuesToFill() was called last. Maintaining them is

very tricky due to race conditions.



This CL removes the mechanism as a whole. This is made possible by

the following CLs that had moved code out of ContentAutofillDriver

and thus also out of ContentAutofillRouter:

- crrev.com/c/4793619

- crrev.com/c/4794552

- crrev.com/c/4803883

entry.title: [Autofill] Move popup-hiding on frame deletion to AutofillPopupControllerImpl
entry.content:
The Autofill popup should should be closed when

- the frame that contains the associated field is removed, or

- the visibility of the tab changes.

Before this CL, this logic lived in ContentAutofillDriverFactory.



This CL moves this mechanism to AutofillPopupControllerImpl (Chrome)

and AutofillProviderAndroid (WebView): both now observe

RenderFrameDeleted() and OnVisibilityChanged() to close the

popup.



This is the final step to remove

ContentAutofillRouter::last_queried_{source,target}_.

entry.title: [sign-in/egtests] Support signed-in user opting into history sync
entry.content:
With kReplaceSyncPromosWithSignInPromos off, it's possible to call

[SigninEarlGreyUI signinWithFakeIdentity:id enableSync:YES] to enable

sync for a signed-in non-syncing user. At least one test [1] relies on

this. The method name is not great in this case given the user is

already signed-in, but that's a pre-existing issue.



This CL adds the same support for when the flag is on. As with

https://crrev.com/c/4801338, the outcome is a history sync opt-in.



[1] BringAndroidTabsNoInitialAlertTestCase/testUserWhoIsNotEnrolledInSyncShouldNotSeePromptUntilSync

entry.title: Revert "Use unique trace ids for console timings with different names"
entry.content:
This reverts commit d9112555e291d0bf358fa24264b138549a33a759.



Reason for revert: Causing https://crbug.com/1475959



Original change's description:

> Use unique trace ids for console timings with different names

>

> Console timing events can be used to measure the duration of a task in

> JS and the recorded data is added to the performance panel timeline data

> via trace events. A console.time('name') event dispatches a trace begin

> event and a console.end('name') dispatches a trace end event.

>

> Before this cl, the trace id used to dispatch console timing events was

> a pointer to the process and, as a consequence, was shared within

> console timing events in the same process, regardless of the console

> timing name. This was problematic because the trace id is used to match

> trace begin and end events. Meaning that the trace end event dispatched for a given console.end will always be matched with the latest trace begin event that was dispatched. However, there is no guarantee that a console.end call is intended to end the last console.time call. Instead they should be matched by name, which this CL achieves by using the timing name the API was called with in the id of the trace event.

>

> Co-authored-by: jacktfranklin@chromium.org

> Fixed: 1455582

>

> Change-Id: I3a4d463254e4137861e7065cb3e4ea9e11476ec4

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4665408

> Reviewed-by: Yang Guo

> Commit-Queue: Andres Olivares

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1169185}

Bug: 1475959



Change-Id: I6e9a3c52c46c9ed008b5635e5d139d5e93cc072f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4822848

Reviewed-by: Simon Zünd

Reviewed-by: Alex Rudenko

Commit-Queue: Andres Olivares

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1190042}

entry.title: [office] fix UMA logging on QuickOffice fallback
entry.content:
When opening a file fails and the user is presented with a QuickOffice

fallback dialog, log metrics as follows:



- Log open result only once after the last try, before the user selects

QuickOffice or cancel, to have task result count be consistent with

open result count. Failure codes will be the same between retries in

the majority of cases.

- Log cancellation from the fallback dialog as kCancelled instead of

kFailedToOpen.

entry.title: [PA] Templatenize alloc flags
entry.content:
- Move |unsigned int flags| param to template parameter.

- Merge |AllocWithFlags| into |Alloc|

- Add |AllocInline| for inlined |Alloc|

- Rename |AlignedAllocWithFlags| into |AlignedAlloc|

- Add |AlignedAllocInline| for inlined |AlignedAlloc|

- Merge |ReallocWithFlags| into |Realloc|

- Add |ReallocInline| for inlined |Realloc|

- constexpr-nized if over flags

- Explicitly instantiate |Alloc|, |AlignedAlloc|, |Realloc|

- This should save some compile time





free flags were templatenized in: crrev.com/c/4722182
